Question: A spring-mass system consists of a spring stretched by a 9.33-kg weight, with the damping constant being \(1.542 \mathrm{kg}-\mathrm{sec} / \mathrm{m}\), and the spring constant being 5.697 N/m. If the mass is released from -0.337 m below the equilibrium position (considering downward as positive) with an initial velocity of \(0.843 \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{sec}\), calculate the displacement of the mass from its equilibrium position at t = 5 seconds, rounded to three significant figures.
